intro: Friedlandia verbenifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf fairybells, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, upright growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Friedlandia verbenifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
